ratings.comment: Horrible Canvas layout, expects you to read 200page books a week, kind of unwelcominging in discussion if she doesnt agree with your opinions she just shuts them down as wrong, horriblly tough grader on 2(two) assignments all semester, she treats it like shes teaching 9th grade english, never put grades in the canvas even after the grading deadline

I really liked Dr. Fecu. The course material was thought-provoking and made for interesting discussion. She's a really interesting person too, young but very respectable. I liked the class atmosphere, it felt friendly. Participation is super important to get a good grade. I wouldn't say she's condescending, but maybe a bit firm in her own beliefs.

It is currently December 22 and there is not a single grade in the grade book. She also is one of those professors who refuses to give out an A. Very condescending and gives unclear instructions that are buried within huge blocks of text. Avoid if possible

Dr. Fecu is super knowledgeable and really helps with the process of analyzing media. There is a lot of reading and the grading criteria is pretty unclear, alongside taking forever to put grades on canvas. If you aren't an English major I would not recommend this course, but I found it very valuable despite some drawbacks.

She has the worst Canvas layout. Everything was just piled in the Files section. She has unclear essay expectations and no set grading pattern. She is very smart, but she loves to hear herself talk. She is a great person, but not the best professor. Her writing feedback can feel frustrating and unclear, so make sure to go to office hours.

Listen, I adored Dr. Fecu. She was incredibly thorough and tried her best to respect what everyone had to say. She was also down to earth and approachable. She is a bit of a harsh grader, but that just means she's invested in improving your skills, and she provides detailed feedback and invites conversation to ensure you know how to improve.

This class was a great learning experience. Professor Fecu is a great resource on campus to learn how to read and write better. Honestly felt like she's one of the only teachers that have actually taken the time to evaluate my writing with high expectations and willing to give back feedback on how to improve.

Definitely has high expectations of her students and pushing us to be the best we can be. Was the only class at UW that really improved my writing. She detailed exactly how to write an analytical essay and gives multiple opportunities to revise your same essays to actual improve your skills. Loved her class and would recommend her to anyone!!

My biggest issue is how Dr. Fecu has the habit of telling you your opinion is wrong. I know myself and others were scared to speak up in class because she would lowkey roast your response if it didn't match her idea of the correct answer. Doesn't make for a very welcoming classroom atmosphere.

She was a really harsh grader for a class meant to help students get introduced to English. She never puts grades in and you don't know your grade until after the class is over. Her quizzes are difficult for no reason. She was nice to a point but I would not take this class again.

Professor Fecu was my favorite professor I have had so far. While there is quite a lot of reading in the beginning, the class is interesting and engaging. You must do the readings to do well in this class, but Professor Fecu is very understanding if you work with her. Speak up in class and communicate with her and you will do well.
She doesn't put grades in until the end of the semester, so it's hard to know what to expect.

The class itself was fascinating. However, I found that Fecu was rarely clear about what she expected from students and I know a lot of my classmates were intimidated to speak in class. She's a fun person and a passionate professor, but I found her to be disorganized. Did not handle the switch to online bc of Corona well either.
